It is characterized by its thin, leathery thallus that is typically pale green to yellowish in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a green alga, which provides it with nutrients through photosynthesis. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found on tree bark or rocks in temperate regions. Its morphology includes a filamentous structure that distinguishes it from other varieties within the Opercularia genus.
